[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: assembler] [Handle Index Bounds] When building bytecode instructions that reference function/struct handles, are handle indices properly validated against table bounds, or can out-of-bounds indices be embedded causing VM crashes during bytecode verification? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: assembler] [Branch Target Validation] In build_instr() for br_true/br_false/branch instructions, can forward branch labels reference non-existent code offsets, creating invalid control flow that bypasses Move's bytecode verifier? (High)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: assembler] [Variant Field Indexing] For enum/variant types, can borrow_variant_field instructions reference field offsets that differ across variants, causing memory safety violations during field access? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: assembler] [Acquires List Manipulation] Can the acquires clause in function definitions be manipulated to omit global resources that are actually accessed, bypassing Move's borrow checking for global storage? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: assembler] [Vector Type Instantiation] In vec_pack/vec_unpack instructions, can mismatched element counts between the instruction argument and actual stack values cause buffer overflows or underflows in vector operations? (High)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: assembler] [Closure Mask Manipulation] In pack_closure instructions, can the ClosureMask bitfield be crafted to capture more variables than declared, accessing out-of-scope memory in closure environments? (Critical)
